channel.title: Data Structures on Gati Aher
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on Gati Aher

item.title: Data Structures for Large Scale Information Retrieval
item.description: Highest Level Overview Inverted indexes are widely used by most large data retrieval systems because it supports keyword search in constant time. Compression codes can be applied to inverted indexes to reduce memory storage. Using Elias-Fano and Partitioned Elias-Fano gives several advantages with low time trade-off. An alternative data-structure, BitFunnel, has a compact representation and provides fast querying performance while avoiding costly global document ingestion operations. 5-minute video: 1 INTRODUCTION 2 BACKGROUND INFORMATION 2.
